intro: Rhinanthus patulus, commonly known as the slender yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes various parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a distinctive two-lipped structure. Rhinanthus patulus is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in areas with well-drained ground.
